body.name: Her Mystery of a Marquess: A Historical Regency Romance Novel (The Brooks Book 2)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A wonderful crafted historical regency romance story that captures the mind and a wonderful plot that has twisted and changed over

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars sweet romance and intrigue
reviews.reviewText: This story is about the elder sister, Joanna and a ducal heir, James. They initially meet at a ball after a spontaneous meeting with his sister Rachael. They also accidentally meet again at his printing shop which unbeknownst to them begins somewhat of a courtship, as unexpected events, mysteries and intrigue begin to bring them together and carry through to their hea. Overall a nice read though parts of it were a bit dramatic.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars His father is the villain
reviews.reviewText: Our heroine falls a good man with an especially evil father to whom power is the most important matter in life. This clean love story is about setting the situation right.Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An awesome book!
reviews.reviewText: I really like the two main characters! I really detested the villain. I love happy ending books. I also enjoyed the family dynamic of the lady’s family.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed this book, it keeps the reader avidly reading. It would be good if more authors of historical romance stories could actually have real stories like this one. There were still a few Americanisms, which was the only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 stars. I recommend this book as being very pleasant read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars When evil walks in….
reviews.reviewText: A spinster at 24, an author, a devoted daughter and sister. Enters her hero, James, son of Duke. An evil Duke, James father, stalking Joanna, to make her his third wife. This family, unlike many nobles, is different in that they don’t care if she marries, if she’s happy. The author has done a beautiful job of creating female characters that are outspoken and not afraid of other’s opinions. The kidnapping, the culmination of the horridly scary notes, is the thing that finally brings the Duke down. His own arrogance, gave them all the ammunition they needed. He was the ultimate villain, a hater of women,a narcissist. Loved the rescue, wouldn’t have guessed who’d come at the ninth hour. But don’t want to ruin it for anyone else. Need to read it yourself.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A talented writer and the intriguing owner of a printing business endure a real mystery !
reviews.reviewText: Joanna and James are developed as authentic characters. In order to financially help her family’s finances, Joanna uses her imagination to create popular stories. However, she does not use her real name. Women are not accepted as authors at this time in history. Since his evil father denies him an inheritance, James decides to build a business for personal income. Both of them are helping their younger sisters have an enjoyable London Season. The delightful dialogue and tender romance is embellished by the mystery they both need to endure. The dastardly, insulting, arrogant villain is especially disturbing by sending Joanna letters full of threats. Joanna is an intelligent, witty woman. James is a genuine hero and very kind person. This is a page turner and very enjoyable to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: A Good Story with Danger Along the Way
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this story. It has strong characters, hidden identities, danger and romance. There are also characters from two very different families. Lady Joanna writes stories and has been publishing them under a pseudonym. Lord Haddington buys the publishers and is unaware that Joanna writes. They meet at a ball whilst keeping watch over their sisters. They develop feelings for each other but Joanna is being threatened by a mysterious man. The story has a lot of danger, threats and a man with an obnoxious attitude to women. Will there Joanna be able to stay safe? Will she find happiness eventually? Read on and enjoy.
I’m terrible at reviews. But it seems that the quantity is as important as the quality. So this review is one for the quantity. The story is worth a read too. 😂👍

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a great read not a boring word in it it is really a not put down read lots of mystery but tender moments I loved the part where James sank down by the plant pots and Joanna joined him at the ball such a lovely tender moment could not stop reading it recommend it most highly thank you
Interesting different it has a good pace and you keep reading wanting to know how it ends. A lovely happy ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: wonderful conclusion to the Brook sisters story
reviews.reviewText: This is part two of the Brook sisters story and rounds up the story of the two eldest sisters wonderfully Joanne finds love with James after all she has done for her family and gets a HEA she never dreamed she would recieve.
